title: How much is a World War 1 victory medal worth? - Quora

response.answer_text: That entirely depends on which nation issued it. United States victory medals are cheap due to their non-affiliation to any one person, much unlike the British and their territories who inscribed the medal with the recipient’s name, rank, and regiment (typically). Smaller nations such as Belgium, Cuba, Greece and Portugal will have a higher value due to their relatively small numbers. Siam, I would argue, is the most valuable since only 1,500 were ever issued. Unfortunately, Victory Medals are heavily reproduced now since World War One is “in vogue”. That said, there is not a very high market for these as opposed to Iron Crosses or the Croix de Guerre. The United States, Italy, and France alone make up over 6,500,000 Victory Medals ever issued.

World war 1 Victory Medal (also called the Inter Allied Victory Medal) is a bronze medal that was awarded to all who received the 1914 Star or 1914-15 Star and, with certain exceptions, to those who received the British War Medal.
